newsitem.title: UK: TENNIS-TRADERS SUFFER IN WIMBLEDON WEATHER SLUMP.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-TRADERS SUFFER IN WIMBLEDON WEATHER SLUMP.

text.p: Local traders are suffering as much as long-suffering spectators at the rain-ravaged Wimbledon championships, with takings dramatically down.
A stall-holder outside Southfields station said he would normally expect to take 2,000 pounds ($3,330) per day from hungry and thirsty tennis fans on their way to the All England Club.
On Friday, the tournament's second completely washed out day, he made just 20 pounds ($33).
"I've bought in 42,000 cans of drink for the two weeks and I would normally be expecting to order more by now," he said on Saturday. "But I've only moved three and a half thousand."
Traders were also slashing the price of Wimbledon '97 T-shirts, fearing they would be out of date before the weather cheers up enough for anyone to want to wear them.
